1.q_string: If the flux of magnetic induction through each turn of a coil of resistance \(\mathrm{R}\) with \(\mathrm{n}\) turns changes from \(\phi_{1}\) to \(\phi_{2}\) then the magnitude of the charge that passes through the coil is

q_option: current flows along ABC in the other coil
current flows along CBA in the other coil
no current flows in the other coil
an alternating current flows in the other coil
1.q_string: The figure below shows two coils placed close to each other. When the current through one coil is decreased gradually by shifting the position of the rheostat, then

q_option: \(\frac{1}{2} B v \pi \mathrm{R}^{2}\) and \(\mathrm{M}\) is at a higher potential
\(\pi \mathrm{R} \mathrm{Bv}\) and \(\mathrm{Q}\) is at a higher potential
\(2 R B v\) and \(Q\) is at a higher potential

An electron moves along the line PQ, which lies in the same plane as a circular loop of conducting wire as shown in the figure. What will be the direction of induced current in the loop?

Two circuits 1 and 2 are connected to identical DC sources, each of emf \(12 \mathrm{V}\). Circuit 1 has a self-inductance \(L_{1}=10\) \(\mathrm{H}\) and circuit 2 has a self-inductance \(\mathrm{L}_{2}=10 \mathrm{mH}\). The total resistance of each circuit is \(48 \Omega .\) What is the ratio of energies consumed in circuits 1 and 2 to build up the current to the steady state value?

A longer solenoid of diameter \(0.1 \mathrm{m}\) has \(2 \times 10^{4}\) turns per meter. At the center of the solenoid, a coil of 100 turns and radius \(0.01 \mathrm{m}\) is placed with its axis coinciding with the solenoid axis. The current in the solenoid reduces at a constant rate to \(0 A\) from \(4 A\) in \(0.05 s .\) If the resistance of the coil is \(10 \pi^{2} \Omega,\) the total charge flowing through the coil during this time is:

At the centre of the solenoid, a 100 -turn coil of radius \(0.01 \mathrm{m}\) is placed with its axis coinciding with the solenoid axis. The current in the solenoid is decreased at a constant rate from \(+2 \mathrm{A}\) to \(-2 \mathrm{A}\) in \(0.08 \mathrm{s}\). The mutual inductance of the system is
